After isolating the LHCII antenna of PSII by sucrose gradient ultracentrifugation of solubilized thylakoids, we confirmed by western blot analysis, that the band used for polyamine analysis presented all major LHCII proteins in both lines, as well as TGZ protein in the case of OE, (Figure 6).

Co-isolation of substrate (i.e. LHCII) and enzyme (i.e. TGZ) in the same fraction of the sucrose gradient confirms and extends previous immunolocalization and proteomic studies showing that TGase is found in appressed regions of thylakoids [10] and isolated in a supercomplex, that once separated in a second dimension, included LHCII and PsbS proteins [16].
